value: The interface is used to submit information related to video stream identification, and after the stream is stably pulled, the corresponding recognition results will be continuously called back to the specified callback address.

Communication Protocol: HTTP or HTTPS protocol
Request Method: POST method
Character Encoding: utf-8
Parameter Format: All request parameters and response parameters are in JSON format.
Common streaming addresses currently support RTMP, RTMPS, HLS, HTTP, HTTPS protocols, and support formats such as FLV, M3U8.

When a user receives a push result and the HTTP status code returned is 200, it indicates that the push was successful; otherwise, the system will attempt to push again (until the maximum number of retries is reached). The retry logic is to retry after intervals of [5,10,15,20,25,30,35,40,45,50,55,60] seconds, and if it still fails after 12 attempts, no further retries will be made.

To prevent streaming failure issues caused by network abnormalities, the Shumei video streaming service has implemented a retry mechanism after streaming failure. The specific mechanism is as follows:

Regular streams, Imagination/Tencent/Volcano streams: A total of 12 retries will be attempted, each lasting five minutes, with time intervals of [5, 10, 15, 20...60 seconds]. For example, Shumei will first attempt to stream continuously for 5 minutes; if it fails to stream, it will wait for 5 seconds before attempting another 5 minutes of continuous streaming. If it still fails, it will wait for 10 seconds before trying another 5 minutes of streaming, and so on.

 Agora streams: No retries, disconnect after 5 minutes of streaming timeout.

Suggested timeout: 7s
The internal processing timeout is 3s, with one retry. Normal interface response time is within 100ms.

value.supportProduct:
Chinese Video Stream
English Video Stream
Arabic Video Stream

value.param_description: View details in the attachment of the account activation email.
Event identifier. It is necessary to agree on the values with Shumei.see email for details.
Application Identifier. This field is strictly validated and requires prior agreement with Shumei on the value to be used.see email for details.

The types of content that need to be recognized in video streams, and at least one of imgBusinessType must be passed.
Optional values:
POLITY: Recognition of political content
EROTIC: Recognition of erotic and sexy violations
VIOLENT: Recognition of violent and prohibited content
QRCODE: QR code recognition
ADVERT: Advertisement recognition
IMGTEXTRISK: Recognition of image text violations
If multiple functions need to be recognized, connect them with an underscore, such as POLITY_QRCODE_ADVERT for a combination of political, QR code, and advertisement recognition.

The types of audio that need to be identified in video streams, and at least one of audioBusinessType must be passed.
Optional values:
POLITY: Political identification
EROTIC: Erotic identification
ADVERT: Advertising identification
BAN: Prohibited content identification
VIOLENT: Violent and terrorist identification
DIRTY: Insult identification
ADLAW: Advertising law
MOAN: Moaning identification
AUDIOPOLITICAL: Voiceprint identification of the top leader
ANTHEN: National anthem identification
BANEDAUDIO: Prohibited songs
NONE: No audio detection
If a combination of identifications is required, simply connect them with an underscore, for example, POLITY_EROTIC for both political and erotic identification.
The business types of images that need to be recognized in the video stream, and at least one of imgType should be passed, with optional values seen in the business label types.

Audio business identification types in video streams, at least one of audioType should be passed.
Optional values:
SING: Singing recognition
LANGUAGE: Language recognition (Chinese, English, Cantonese, Tibetan, Uyghur, Korean, Mongolian, others)
MINOR: Minor recognition
GENDER: Gender recognition
TIMBRE: Timbre recognition
VOICE: Vocal characteristics
AUDIOSCENE: Sound scene
AGE: Age recognition
APPNAME: App name recognition
To recognize timbre, singing, and language, GENDER must also be passed to take effect.
If multiple functions need to be recognized, they should be connected with an underscore.
Image callback URL: The detection results of the frame images captured from the video stream are returned to the user through this address.
Audio callback URL: The detection results of audio segments in the video stream are returned to the user through this address; it is required when audio recognition is needed.
The requested data content should not exceed 1M in size.

son.param_description:
Video stream types with selectable values:
NORMAL: Regular stream address, currently supports rtmp, rtmps, hls, http, https protocols
AGORA: Agora review
TRTC: Tencent review
ZEGO: Zego review
VOLC: Volcano Engine review
ALI: Alibaba Cloud review
Note: When using the RTC SDK recording solution, additional recording costs may be incurred on the RTC side. Please consult the relevant RTC manufacturers for specific costs.
User account identifier. It is recommended to pass in the user ID, which can be used for risk identification in dimensions such as spamming, advertising, etc.
Streamer Name, generally used for human review required fields.

The audio review step size in the video stream. The unit is pieces, and the value range is 1-36 integers. A value of 1 indicates skipping the review of one 10-second audio segment, a value of 2 indicates skipping two, and so on. When this feature is not used, all audio content is reviewed.

The interval frequency for frame capture in a video stream. The unit is seconds, with a range of 1 to 60 seconds. Fractional values are rounded down, and values less than 1 are processed as 1 second. If not specified, the default is to capture a frame every 3 seconds.

Frame capture interval for video stream image detection. Each captured frame will only be detected once per interval, with a value greater than or equal to 1. When this feature is not used, all captured frames will be approved without review.
Shumei device fingerprint identification. Generated by ShuMei SDK, used for user behavior analysis.

User Gender, suggested values:
male: male
female: female
ambiguity: ambiguous gender

Image business label detection step size. Each step size will only detect imgBusinessType once, with a value greater than or equal to 1.
>Default value = 1, representing that all segments are reviewed for business labels.

The reference image for comparison detection. The `businessType` field in the request parameters should include the label `FACECOMPARE` when present.
Supported image URL formats:
jpg, jpeg, png, webp, gif, tiff, tif, heif
It is recommended that the image pixels are not less than 256*256.
The reference image currently does not support animated formats.
Client's public IP address. This parameter is used for user behavior analysis based on the IP dimension.

Language Type. You can specify the language type for frame capture and audio segment content detection (default is Chinese), with the following options:
zh: Chinese
en: English
ar: Arabic
Live Stream Cover, generally used for fields required by human review.
Live Stream Title: A live stream title is typically required for human review fields.
The message recipient's tokenId is a string composed of numbers, letters, underscores, and hyphens, with a length of no more than 64 characters.

Return the risk level of the frame capture recognition results. The available options are as follows: (the default value is 0)
0: Return image audit information with a risk level other than pass.
1: Return image audit information for all risk levels.

Return the risk level of audio recognition results. The optional values are as follows (default is 0):
0: Return audio segments and text content with a risk level that is not pass.
1: Return audio segments and text content for all risk levels.

Video stream end callback notification. The optional values are as follows: (default value is 0)
1: Initiate an end notification when the review ends, and add the statCode status code to the callback parameters.
0: Do not send an end notification when the review ends.

Should return information from the previous segment. The optional values are as follows:
1: The returned preAudioUrl field contains links to audio segments of the previous 10 seconds and the current 10 seconds, totaling 20 seconds.
0: Do not return information from the previous segment.

Should the previous segment's text information be returned? The optional values are as follows:
1: The returned content field includes the text content of the audio segment from the previous 10 seconds and the current 10 seconds, totaling 20 seconds.
0: Do not return the text information of the previous segment.
Live room/game room ID, allowing for the development of different strategies for individual rooms.
Video Stream Name for display in the backend interface, it is recommended to input.
The URL address of the regular stream for the video to be detected.
Agora Recording Parameters (required when streamType is AGORA)
Agora App ID
Channel Name provided by Agora

Does it support recording H.265 video streams?
false: (default) Does not support recording H.265 video streams. Remote users within the channel cannot send H.265 video streams.
true: Supports recording H.265 video streams.

Enable keyframe requests. This parameter is set to true by default, which can improve the audio and video experience under poor network conditions. If you need to specify the playback position for the recorded video in single-stream mode, you must set enableIntraRequest to false.
false: Disable keyframe requests, all the sending ends in the channel send a keyframe every 2 seconds. After disabling, the playback position of the recorded video in single-stream mode can be specified.
true: The sending end controls whether to enable keyframe requests. After enabling, the playback position of the recorded video file in single-stream mode cannot be specified.

Subscription Mode.
AUTO: Automatically subscribes to all streams within the room; this is the default behavior when subscribeMode is not set.
UNTRUSTED: Works in conjunction with the untrustedUserIdList to only subscribe to streams specified by this list. In this mode, if the untrustedUserIdList is empty, it is considered a parameter error because no streams can be subscribed to.
TRUSTED: Works in conjunction with the trustedUserIdList to only subscribe to streams outside of this list. In this mode, if no users not on the trustedUserIdList enter the room for a certain period, meaning the untrustedUserIdList is empty, the audit will be proactively terminated by the system.

Users with higher security requirements can use tokens for authentication. For details on how to generate tokens, please refer to the Agora documentation: (https://docs.agora.io/en/Recording/token_server?platform=CPP)

It is recommended to set the token's validity period to exceed the duration of the channel to prevent the token from expiring and causing streaming issues. Agora currently supports a maximum token validity period of 24 hours. Therefore, when the channel duration exceeds 24 hours, it is necessary to handle token expiration issues. The method to handle this is to set the returnFinishInfo parameter to 1 in the request to enable audio stream end callback notifications. When the callback receives an audit end notification (statCode set to 1), and the reason is due to the invalid or expired streaming token, if the channel still exists and requires continued auditing, generate a new token and resubmit the channel for review.

A 32-bit unsigned integer. When a token is present, the user ID used to generate the token must be provided.
Note that it is necessary to distinguish between the actual user ID (uid) in the room and the uid provided to the server for recording purposes, which must not exist in the room.

List of trusted users, takes effect when subscribeMode is set to TRUSTED, must not be empty, and the platform will not subscribe to the streams of users specified in this list within the room.
A comma-separated array of UIDs, such as [1,2], with a maximum of 17 users.

A list for non-trusted users, which takes effect when subscribeMode is set to UNTRUSTED, and must not be empty. It only subscribes to the streams of the users specified in this list within the room.
A comma-separated array of UIDs, such as [1,2], with a maximum of 17 users.
Ali Engine Recording Parameters (required when streamType is ALI)

Room ID must be exactly the same as the channel ID used to generate the token. The server pulls and records streams on a per-room basis. The room serves as a unique identifier, and the same room will not pull streams repeatedly.

Used for the pulling end to join the channel, the generation method is detailed in the document: https://help.aliyun.com/zh/live/user-guide/token-based-authentication, a new token must be regenerated each time for upload and review.
Alibaba User Account Identifier.
Auxiliary Information
Customers transmit pass-through fields. ShuMei will not recognize or process this field internally and will return it to the user along with the results.
Tencent Recording Parameters (required when streamType is TRTC)

Application scenarios, optional values:
0: Video call scenario
1: Video live streaming scenario, default value: 0. For more details, see: https://cloud.tencent.com/document/product/647/79634#45c6782b29cadc377b5763a5d8490340

Recording type optional values:
Multicast recording: 2
Unicast recording: 4
Tencent-provided SDKAppId

Room number. Value description: Only allows the inclusion of (a-zA-Z), numbers (0-9), underscores, and hyphens.
If you choose strRoomId, please note that if both strRoomId and roomId have values, roomId should be used preferentially.
The userId assigned to the recording end has a length limit of 32 bits and is only allowed to include letters (a-zA-Z), numbers (0-9), underscores, and hyphens.
Record the verification signature corresponding to userId, which is equivalent to the login password.
Room number. Value range: 【1-4294967294】Either roomId or strRoomId must be provided, if both have values, roomId is preferred. Note: Currently, a room can audit a maximum of 8 users only.
Volcano Engine recording parameters (required when streamType is VOLC)
Volcano's application identifier
Room Number
Record the verification signature corresponding to the userId, which is equivalent to the login password.
userId assigned to the recording segment, limited to a length of 32 bits, only allowing (a-zA-Z), numbers (0-9), underscores, and hyphens.
Zego Recording Parameters (required when streamType is ZEGO)
zego's room number

Zego provides authentication information, obtain Zego's identify_token for login, and see the generation method in the Zego documentation: https://doc-zh.zego.im/article/15258 Note that the tokenId is a unique identifier, and a new one must be generated for each request for uploading and content moderation.

Corresponding to code:
1100: Success

son.param_description:
Duplicate requestId indicator
When the errorcode is 1001, indicating a repeated stream push, the dupRequestId field will be returned.
For example, if the first request does not receive a response, but the audio stream has actually started being reviewed, and there is no requestId to actively close the review.
You can request again, receive the message of repeated stream push, and call the close review interface through the returned dupRequestId.
1001: Repeated Streaming

value: The following parameters, except for `code`, `message`, and `requestId`, are all mandatory return parameters when the `code` returns 1100.

value.param_description: ShuMei requests a unique identifier.

Here are the translations for the codes:

1100: Success
1901: QPS Limit Exceeded
1902: Invalid Parameters
1903: Service Failure
1904: Stream Route Limit Exceeded
9101: No Permission to Operate

1100: Success
1901: QPS Limit Exceeded
1902: Invalid Parameters
1903: Service Failure
1904: Exceeded Route Count Limit
9101: No Permission to Operate

Callback status codes. Corresponding relationships:
0: Audit result callback
1: Stream end result callback

Used to differentiate between image and audio callbacks. Possible values are as follows:
1: This callback is for image processing.
2: This callback is for audio processing.
Auxiliary information, the value of passThrough in the extra parameter of the request data is returned.

The character's position information is represented by an array with four values, corresponding to the coordinates of the top-left corner and the bottom-right corner. For example, [207,522,340,567], where:

- 207 represents the x-coordinate of the top-left corner.
- 522 represents the y-coordinate of the top-left corner.
- 340 represents the x-coordinate of the bottom-right corner.
- 567 represents the y-coordinate of the bottom-right corner.

2: The frame capture image has not passed the detection.

Room Number

Value 1, the similarity frame deduplication review feature is active.

User identification, used to distinguish between users violating the rules in the room, unrelated to the userId in the request parameters, and the user ID of the diverted traffic. This field will be returned under the following circumstances:

VOLC stream is audited.
ALI stream is audited.

当然可以，以下是一些按照您要求格式的业务标签中文描述示例：

1. 市场营销：广告宣传：线上广告
2. 产品研发：软件设计：用户界面
3. 客户服务：售后支持：维修服务
4. 财务管理：预算编制：成本控制
5. 人力资源：招聘管理：面试流程
6. 供应链管理：物流配送：库存管理
7. 项目管理：进度控制：风险评估
8. 法律事务：合同管理：知识产权
9. 信息技术：网络安全：数据保护
10. 行政管理：文档管理：会议安排

这些示例涵盖了不同业务领域的一级、二级和三级标签，可以根据实际业务需求进行调整和补充。希望对您有所帮助。

value.param_description: Audio clip information. Return when there are risky clips or returnAllText=1.

son.param_description: Audio clip address.

Label Explanation: When a user-defined list is hit, return: "Hit Custom List"; when the riskLevel is PASS, return "Normal"; in other cases, display the format as First-Level Label: Second-Level Label: Third-Level Label in Chinese name, only for reference when people need to understand the reasons for the risk, and programs should not rely on the value of this parameter for logical processing.
Level 1 Risk Label, returns "normal" when riskLevel is PASS.
Secondary Risk Label, empty when riskLevel is PASS.
Level 3 Risk Label, when riskLevel is PASS, it is empty.

Identification results, possible return values:
PASS: Normal, recommended to release directly
REVIEW: Suspicious, recommended for manual review
REJECT: Violation, recommended to intercept directly

Mute segment.
0: Mute segment
1: Non-mute segment
Complete list of risk labels

Risk Description. When riskLevel is PASS, return: Normal. Format: "First-level risk label: Second-level risk label: Third-level risk label" in Chinese. For hits on user-defined lists, return: Hit custom list.
Level 1 Risk Label, returns "normal" when riskLevel is PASS.
Secondary Risk Label, empty when riskLevel is PASS.
Tier 3 Risk Label, when riskLevel is PASS, it is empty.

Identification results, possible return values:
PASS: Normal, recommended to release directly
REVIEW: Suspicious, recommended for manual review
REJECT: Violation, recommended to intercept directly

For each segment of content, return the risk details only if the type is NOVEL. If the returnHtml parameter is true, only return the REJECT and REVIEW risk content segments. If the returnHtml parameter is false, return all content segments (including REJECT, REVIEW, and PASS).

Risk sources, possible values are:
1000: No risk
1001: Text risk
1002: Visual image risk
1003: Audio speech risk

Auxiliary Information High-Risk Content Segment
The position of high-risk content segments, with indexing starting from 0.

The text content recognized from the audio in the video stream. When the returnPreText value is 1, and the current audio segment is rejected, return the text content of the current 10-second and the previous 10-second audio segments, totaling 20 seconds. Otherwise, only return the text content of the current segment.

Return the link to the previous audio clip. If `returnPreAudio` is set to 1 and the current audio clip is marked as 'reject', return a link to a 20-second audio clip that includes the current 10 seconds and the previous 10 seconds. Otherwise, do not return anything.

ZEGO stream is reviewed by room number.

ALI stream is reviewed.
Agora user account identifier. Only exists in the case of traffic distribution, the returned userId is the actual user ID in the room, which is unrelated to the uid in the request parameters.
Customers transmit pass-through fields. ShuMei will not recognize or process this field internally and will return it to the user along with the results.
Business Tag List

Confidence. The optional value is between 0 and 1, the larger the value, the higher the credibility.
Confidence level, with optional values between 0 and 2, the higher the, value the higher the credibility.
Risk Details Information

Risk Sources, possible values are:
1000: No Risk
1001: Text Risk
1003: Audio Speech Risk
The text content recognized in this segment.
Customer-specific list information is only returned when a match is found in the customer's custom list.
List Name
Sensitive word information in this hit list.
Sensitive words hit
The positions of high-risk content segments, with indexing starting from 0.
High-risk content segments. There is a presence when detecting images that contain politically sensitive, violent and terrorist, prohibited, competitive product, and advertising law violations.
Auxiliary Information High-Risk Content Segment
The position of high-risk content segments starts counting from index 0.

value.param_description: Account attribute tags. Returned only when tokenId is provided and the tag service is enabled.

Primary Tag
Secondary Labels

Label timestamp 13-digit Unix timestamp, unit: milliseconds

value.param_description: Account Risk Label. Returns only when the token ID is passed and the label service is activated.

Primary Label
Secondary Labels

Tagging timestamp 13-digit Unix timestamp, unit: milliseconds

value.param_description: Shumei requests a unique identifier.

Here are the translations for the codes:

1100: Success
1901: QPS Limit Exceeded
1902: Invalid Parameters
1903: Service Failure
1904: Exceeded Stream Count Limit
9101: No Permission to Operate

1100: Success
1901: QPS Limit Exceeded
1902: Invalid Parameters
1903: Service Failure
1904: Exceeded Number of Stream Routes
9101: No Permission to Operate

Return overall stream disposal recommendations at the end of the callback. Possible return values:
PASS: Normal, recommend to let it pass directly
REVIEW: Suspicious, recommend manual review
REJECT: Violation, recommend direct interception

Callback status code, which exists when returnFinishInfo is 1. The status code correspondence is as follows:
0: Audit result callback
1: Stream end result callback.

Used to distinguish between audio and image callback completions. Possible values are as follows:
1: This callback is for the end of image review.
2: This callback is for the end of audio review.

Whether the stream pulling is successful. Possible values are as follows:
true: Stream pulling is successful
false: Stream pulling has failed
If no screenshots are successfully obtained, it is considered that the stream pulling has failed.
Auxiliary Information

son.param_description: Stream audit duration. The last return after the stream ends represents the submission duration. If there is an interval audit logic, it may not be consistent with the actual duration of the stream.

value.param_description: Return all fields in the data parameter of the request. Return when contentType is 2.
Details information. Return when contentType is 1.

son.param_description: Retrieve all fields from the request parameter data.
